document.full_text: a memphis county official has opened an online museum of case files, personal correspondence and little-seen black-and-white images chronicling the jail time of james earl ray, who killed civil rights leader martin luther king jr. 43 years ago this monday.
document.title: pictures, letters of king assassin shown in online museum
lines_and_colors: a memphis county official has opened an online museum of case files, personal correspondence and little-seen black-and-white images chronicling the jail time of james earl ray, who killed civil rights leader martin luther king jr. 43 years ago this monday.
